subject: Re: [junit] Version of Junit
msgSnippet: So said  ranjan_chakrab   on  2002-12-16 ... Do you have the original package? If so, that file probably has the version number in
messageBody:
So said ranjan_chakrab <ranjan_chakrab@...> on 2002-12-16
--------------------

>I have Junit installed in my Linux (Red Hat version 7.3)in my
>machine. How can I tell the current version of JUnit?

Do you have the original package? If so, that file probably has the
version number in its name.

How much detail do you need? I can tell the difference between v3.8+
and v3.7- by looking at the interface of class TestCase: if it has a
no-argument constructor, then you have v3.8 or later; if not, you have
v3.7 or earlier.

J. B. Rainsberger,
